intro: Cystodiopteris sorbifolia, commonly known as the sorb tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of feathery leaves that can reach several meters in length. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fronds are used in traditional Māori crafts and have cultural significance in New Zealand.
